item.title: 汇丰银行：近期黄金交易价格可能突破4000美元/盎司
item.description: 汇丰银行表示，受地缘政治风险、财政不确定性和美联储独立性受到威胁的影响，黄金近期的交易价格可能会超过每盎司4000美元。【原文：HSBC said gold could trade above $4,000 per ounce in the near term, driven by geopolitical risks, fiscal uncertainties, and threats to the Federal Reserve’s independence.】

item.title: 独家报道：巴蒂斯塔兄弟的 J&F 公司与法国电力集团洽谈巴西能源工厂事宜
item.description: 据两位熟悉内情的人士透露，巴西亿万富翁巴蒂斯塔兄弟拥有的控股公司 J&F Investimentos SA 正在洽谈收购法国电力公司 EDF 的里约热内卢热电厂。【原文：J&F Investimentos SA, the holding company owned by Brazil's billionaire Batista brothers, is in talks to acquire French utility EDF's Rio de Janeiro thermal plant, according to two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 消息人士称，随着沙特和俄罗斯就石油规模展开辩论，欧佩克+将再次上调石油价格
item.description: 四位了解欧佩克+谈判的人士说，欧佩克+八国可能在周日进一步提高石油产量，该集团的领头羊沙特阿拉伯将推动大幅增产，以重新夺回市场份额，而俄罗斯则建议小幅增产。【原文：Eight OPEC+ countries are likely to further raise oil output on Sunday with the group’s leader Saudi Arabia pushing for a large increase to regain market share and Russia suggesting a more modest rise, four people with knowledge of OPEC+ talks said.】

item.title: 独家报道：亚马逊推出设备几天后就失去了设备副总裁和首席执行官精英顾问团成员
item.description: 就在亚马逊举办年度设备和服务展示会的几天后，亚马逊就失去了一位帮助监管该部门的副总裁。【原文：Just days after putting on its annual devices and services showcase, Amazon is losing a vice president who helps oversee the division.】

item.title: 受制裁影响的卢布支持代币赞助顶级加密大会
item.description: 本周在新加坡举行的一次重要加密货币会议上，俄罗斯人使用的卢布支持的加密货币需求飙升，该加密货币背后的企业也是会议的赞助商之一。【原文：The business behind a rouble-backed cryptocurrency targeted by U.S. sanctions was among the sponsors of a major crypto conference in Singapore this week, as demand soars for the token, used by Russians.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士：塞内加尔不会在周五的会议上获得国际货币基金组织（IMF）的豁免以清算更多现金
item.description: 两位接近此事的消息人士告诉路透社，国际货币基金组织不打算在周五讨论塞内加尔债务误报豁免问题的董事会会议上进行表决。【原文：The International Monetary Fund isn't planning to vote on a crucial debt misreporting waiver for Senegal during its Friday board meeting at which the matter will be discussed, two sources close to the matters told Reuters.】

item.title: 博雅全球研究公司将美联储降息预期从 12 月下调至 10 月
item.description: 美国银行全球研究部周五将美联储下一次降息的预期从12月提前至10月，理由是劳动力市场出现疲软迹象。【原文：Bank of America Global Research on Friday pulled forward its forecast for the next Federal Reserve interest rate cut to October from December, citing signs of a softening labor market.】

item.title: 美国服务业停滞不前，新订单放缓，就业疲软
item.description: 由于新订单急剧放缓，9 月份美国服务业活动停滞不前，而就业低迷则进一步证明，由于劳动力供需减弱，劳动力市场状况低迷。【原文：U.S. services sector activity stalled in September amid a sharp slowdown in new orders, while subdued employment added to mounting evidence of sluggish labor market conditions because of waning demand and supply of workers.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织称，国家产业政策可能有效，但也存在风险
item.description: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）周五表示，越来越多的国家正在寻求利用对特定企业和部门的公共支持来重塑经济，但补贴和其他产业政策可能代价高昂，除非谨慎利用，否则可能不会有效。【原文：More countries are seeking to reshape their economies using public support for specific firms and sectors, but subsidies and other industrial policies can be costly and may not be effective unless carefully utilized, the IMF said on Friday.】

item.title: 美联储主席古尔斯比 "有点警惕 "前置过多降息 -CNBC
item.description: 芝加哥联储主席奥斯汀-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）周五表示，在通胀率仍高于央行 2% 目标的情况下，他对承诺一系列降息措施犹豫不决，这与他的几位同行对服务业通胀持续存在的担忧不谋而合。【原文：Chicago Federal Reserve President Austan Goolsbee on Friday said he was hesitant to commit to a series of interest rate cuts with inflation still running above the central bank's 2% target, echoing the concerns of several of his peers about the persistence of inflation for services.】

item.title: 美国最高法院将审理埃克森公司要求古巴实体赔偿的案件
item.description: 美国最高法院周五同意审理埃克森美孚公司要求古巴国有企业赔偿其在 1960 年被没收的石油和天然气资产的诉讼，根据联邦法律，美国人可以就被共产党统治的加勒比海国家没收的财产起诉外国公司和个人。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court agreed on Friday to hear ExxonMobil's bid to obtain compensation from Cuban state-owned firms for oil and gas assets seized in 1960 under a federal law that lets Americans sue foreign companies and individuals over property confiscated by the communist-ruled Caribbean country.】

item.title: 太空数据中心？杰夫-贝索斯认为这是可能的
item.description: 亚马逊公司创始人兼执行主席杰夫-贝索斯周五表示，未来10到20年内将在太空建造千兆瓦级的数据中心，并预测由于不间断的太阳能资源丰富，这些数据中心的性能最终将超过地球上的数据中心。【原文：Amazon founder and executive chair Jeff Bezos said on Friday gigawatt-scale data centres will be built in space within the next 10 to 20 years, predicting they would eventually outperform Earth-based ones thanks to the abundance of uninterrupted solar energy.】

item.title: Cirium 称空客 9 月累计交付量转正
item.description: 根据 Cirium 公司的初步数据，空中客车公司 9 月份交付了 70 架喷气式飞机，自今年年初以来的累计交付量首次超过了 2024 年的交付总量。【原文：Airbus delivered a provisional 70 jets in September, lifting the cumulative number of deliveries achieved since the start of the year above the equivalent running total for 2024 for the first time, according to preliminary Cirium data.】

item.title: 冯德莱恩表示，欧盟将提出针对初创企业的统一规则，以帮助它们成长
item.description: 欧盟行政首长周五表示，欧盟计划明年提出一套针对初创企业的单一规则，以帮助集团内的创新企业在整个地区发展和运营，并更容易留住人才。【原文：The European Union plans to propose a single set of rules for startups next year to help the bloc's innovative companies grow and operate across the region and find it easier to retain talent, the head of EU's executive said on Friday.】

item.title: 受降息预期影响，美国股票基金每周资金大幅流入
item.description: 截至 10 月 1 日的一周，美国股票基金因再次押注降息而出现强劲流入，因为一份通胀报告缓解了人们对物价上涨将促使美联储推迟对疲软的劳动力市场提供政策支持的担忧。【原文：U.S. equity funds saw robust inflows in the week to October 1 on renewed bets of rate cuts, as an inflation report eased worries that a buildup in prices would push the Federal Reserve to delay policy support for a weakening labor market.】

item.title: 2025 年迄今发生的美国炼油厂火灾事故
item.description: 周四，雪佛龙公司在洛杉矶附近日产量 28.5 万桶的埃尔塞贡多炼油厂的喷气燃料装置发生火灾，火焰和浓烟弥漫在空中。【原文：A fire broke out in a jet fuel unit at Chevron's 285,000 barrel-per-day El Segundo refinery near Los Angeles on Thursday, sending flames and smoke into the air.】

item.title: 塔里萨公司计划斥资5.47亿美元建设地下铂矿项目
item.description: 南非 Tharisa Plc 公司周五宣布，计划在未来十年内斥资 5.47 亿美元建设一个地下铂族金属开采项目，希望这些金属能成为全球向清洁能源技术转变过程中不可或缺的一部分。【原文：South Africa's Tharisa Plc announced plans on Friday to spend $547 million on an underground platinum group metals mining project over the next decade, betting on the metals being integral to the global shift to cleaner energy technologies.】

item.title: 数据库初创公司 Supabase 在本轮融资中估值达 50 亿美元
item.description: 开源数据库初创公司 Supabase 周五表示，它已在一轮融资中筹集到 1 亿美元，估值达 50 亿美元。【原文：Open-source database startup Supabase said on Friday it has raised $100 million in a funding round, which valued it at $5 billion.】

item.title: 因押注美联储降息，全球股票基金流入量创 11 个月新高
item.description: 截至 10 月 1 日的一周内，全球股票基金需求旺盛，原因是美国通胀报告与预期持平，而民间就业数据弱于预期，重新燃起了人们对美联储降息的希望。【原文：Global equity funds witnessed robust demand in the week through October 1 as an inline U.S. inflation report and weaker-than-expected private payrolls data renewed hopes of Federal Reserve rate cuts.】

item.title: 欧盟冯德莱恩敦促欧洲推动人工智能汽车发展
item.description: 欧盟委员会主席乌苏拉-冯德莱恩（Ursula von der Leyen）周五呼吁在整个欧洲范围内推动自动驾驶汽车的发展，称人工智能有助于重振该地区陷入困境的汽车行业并改善道路安全。【原文：European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen called on Friday for a continent-wide push to develop self-driving cars, saying artificial intelligence could help revive the region's struggling automotive sector and improve road safety.】

item.title: 早安保持冷静，继续前进
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: 路透社报道后，数十部宝莱坞人工智能视频从 YouTube 上消失
item.description: 据路透社报道，谷歌的 YouTube 上已删除了数百部人工智能生成的宝莱坞视频，这些视频的浏览量高达 1600 万次。【原文：Hundreds of AI-generated Bollywood videos with 16 million views have been deleted from Google's YouTube after Reuters reported they were similar to those at the centre of a legal challenge filed by a celebrity couple to protect their rights.】

item.title: 美联储主席威廉姆斯称央行必须做好应对意外的准备
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行行长约翰-威廉姆斯（John Williams）周五表示，不可预测的变化是不可避免的，中央银行需要意识到这一点，并制定在这些环境中运作的策略。【原文：Federal Reserve Bank of New York President John Williams said Friday that unpredictable change is inevitable and central banks need to be aware of that and have strategies to operate in those environments.】

item.title: 冰封的薪资数据给华尔街带来了新的自由时间，但解读经济却存在很大问题
item.description: 美国就业数据的发布通常会让交易员和投资者在早上 8:30 就守在屏幕前，等待这些至关重要的数据。然而，本周五的数据却让一些人突然有了更多的空闲时间，同时还面临着试图从其他来源拼凑经济拼图的问题。【原文：The release of U.S. jobs data typically has traders and investors glued to their screens at 8:30 am waiting for the all-important numbers. This Friday, however, is giving some a sudden surplus of free time along with the problem of trying to piece together the economic jigsaw puzzle from other sources.】

item.title: 陆军备忘录称，Anduril 和 Palantir 战场通信系统存在严重缺陷
item.description: 根据一份最新的陆军内部备忘录，Anduril、Palantir 和其他公司正在对美国陆军亟需的战场通信网络进行现代化改造，但这一改造充斥着 "基本安全 "问题和漏洞，应被视为 "极高风险"。【原文：The much-needed modernization of the U.S. Army's battlefield communications network being undertaken by Anduril, Palantir and others is rife with "fundamental security" problems and vulnerabilities, and should be treated as a "very high risk," according to a recent internal Army memo.】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 华尔街关注华盛顿对峙，股市接近历史纪录
item.description: 在市场进入季节性强劲的第四季度之际，美国政府停摆成为投资者下周的首要议题，接近历史高点的股市正准备迎接本月晚些时候财报季的考验。【原文：The U.S. government shutdown tops investors' agenda next week as markets head into the seasonally strong fourth quarter, with equities near record highs bracing for an earnings-season test later this month.】

item.title: 被大买家中国抛弃的美国豆农争相寻找其他进口商
item.description: 尼日利亚贸易代表团。与越南签署谅解备忘录。从孟加拉国的采购激增。【原文：A trade mission to Nigeria. A memorandum of understanding with Vietnam. A surge of purchases from Bangladesh.】

item.title: 华尔街期货在动荡一周的最后一个交易日攀升
item.description: 在本周动荡不安的最后一个交易日，美国股指期货周五上涨，因为降息的希望支撑了市场情绪。【原文：U.S. stock index futures rose on Friday as hopes of an interest rate cut underpinned sentiment in the final trading session of a volatile week, marked by a government shutdown that has dragged into its third day.】

item.title: 美国稀土股价大涨，此前有报道称矿商正在与白宫进行密切谈判
item.description: 据报道，美国稀土矿业公司首席执行官芭芭拉-汉普顿（Barbara Humpton）表示，该公司正在与白宫进行密切讨论，随后该公司股价在周五的盘前交易中大涨 10%。【原文：USA Rare Earth shares jumped 10% in premarket trading on Friday, after a report that the mining company's CEO Barbara Humpton said it was in close discussions with the White House.】

item.title: Take Five：前方能见度低
item.description: 美国政府已经关门，但这并不妨碍股市再创新高，因为人们完全相信，看涨的降息政策将使股市保持良好势头。唯一的障碍是，人们对当前经济的实际情况完全不了解。【原文：The U.S. government has shut down, but that hasn't prevented stocks from hitting more record highs, fully confident that bullish rate cuts will keep momentum going. The one hitch is a complete lack of visibility when it comes to what is actually happening in the economy right now.】
